resources.string: Recommendations for people to contact based on your message history

Dear Students and Faculty Members
Welcome back to Gangtok. Hope you enjoyed your winter vacation.Some of you would have spent part of the vacation on study tour, fieldwork, internship, national service, etc. while others would have spent time with friends and family members.
\n
\nI am sure you have come back energized and empowered with new knowledge and experience to share with others.
\n
\n
As I welcome you all, I would like to particularly remind the final semester students that this is your last semester. As such, make the best of the remaining days in hand.
\n
\n You are supposed to be mentored by your teachers during this semester.
\n
\nHope they are taking care of your intellectual and emotional needs, answering your queries with empathy, and preparing you for the challenging life outside the university.
\n
\n
\n You are lucky to have highly dedicated teachers, although every one of them may not live up to your expectations.
For the teachers I have charted a huge responsibility in the current semester.First of all I would like you all to give your one hour every week to the weaker among your students.
\nYou can do this without making them feel inferior. All of them were not rich or lucky enough to go to good schools and colleges, and hence generally perform better in your class.
\n Secondly, I would like you to mentor the final semester students, prepare them for the challenges coming their way in the months and years to come.
\n If you do that they will ever remember you and be grateful to you. Finally, we are embarking on a round of major revision of our curriculum.
\n We wish to make our curriculum helpful to our students in cracking various competitive exams as well as cracking the mysteries of life. We also wish to start some add-on certificate courses from the Odd Semester this year, which would help our students face the job market with one extra qualification in hand.
\n
\n All this is not easy to achieve without the cooperation of every faculty member of the university, but I know you will come forward to do all this for the sake of your students even if it is at times challenging for yourselves.
A very happy 2017 to you all
T.B. Subba

string.name: antiragging
string.p:
RAGGING: Any disorderly conduct whether by words spoken or written or by an act which has the effect of teasing, treating or handling with rudeness any other student, indulging in rowdy or undisciplined activities which causes or is likely to cause annoyance, hardship or psychological harm or to raise fear or apprehension thereof in a fresher or a junior student or asking the students to
do any act or perform something which such student will not in the ordinary course and which has the effect of causing or generating a sense of shame or embarrassment so as to adversely affect the physique or psyche of a fresher or a junior student”.
\n
\n
\n Anti-Ragging Cell
\n
1.
Dean, Students’ Welfare Chairman
\n
2
Provost
Member
\n 3
Wardens of all Hostels
Members
\n 4
Building Co-ordinators of all Buildings
Members
\n A student who has been ragged or has seen someone being ragged in hostels or in departments or within the University building may submit his/her complaint to any one of the above members who may bring to the notice to the Dean, Students’ Welfare immediately. Upon receipt of such complaint, the Dean, Students’ Welfare shall convene a meeting of the Cell within three (3) days. Anti-Ragging Cell shall inquire into the complaint. If the complaint is found to be true and perpetrator(s) is/are identified, the Cell may make appropriate recommendations to the Vice-Chancellor as per standing Supreme Court rulings.
\nThe Cell shall sensitize the students on anti-ragging rules from time to time and display notices in hostels and departments informing them of the likely consequences if they indulge in ragging.
\nActivities Considered as Ragging:
\n
\n Any conduct by words spoken or written or an act which has the effect of teasing, threading or handling with rudeness to a fresher or any other student.
\n Financial extortion or act of forceful expenditure.
\n Physical abuses
\n Rowdy/undisciplined activities, which cause or are likely to cause annoyance, hardship, physical/psychological harm or fear or apprehension in any student.
\n Forcing a student to do an act, which generates sense of shame, torment or embarrassment affecting his/her physique or psyche
\n Any act which prevents/disturbs/disrupts regular academic activities assignment to a student
\n Any act or abuse by spoken words, emails, post, public insults which would also include deriving perverted pleasure, vicarious or sadistic thrill from actively participating in the discomfiture to fresher or any other student
\n Any act affecting mental health and self-confidence of student with or without any intent to derive a sadistic pleasure showing off power, authority or superiority
\nThe Recommendations of Shri R. K. Raghavan Committee:
\n
Verbal Ragging: When a senior causes mental harassment, discomfort for the junior by forcing him/her to answer unacceptable/personal questions, dance, sing, etc. is said to rag the junior. It also includes within its ambit “cyber ragging”. Punishment: 1 year imprisonment or fine
Severe Verbal Ragging: Where the mental harassment, discomfort is to such an act as forces the junior to withdraw from the college. Punishment: 7 year imprisonment with fine
Physical Ragging: Any act by the senior towards the junior which inflicts bodily injury on the junior. Like beating the junior, hitting him/her with objects etc. Punishment: 7 year imprisonment with fine
Sexual Ragging: where the senior asks the junior to do an act which damages sexual dignity of the junior. Punishment: 7 year rigorous imprisonment and fine
\nOBJECTIVES:
\n
\nTo Curb the Menace of Ragging in Sikkim University
\n
\nAnti Ragging Policy – Ragging is strictly banned in the premises of Sikkim University and its affiliated institutions. If anybody found indulging in such activities, strict action will be taken irrespective of the extent.
\n To prevent ragging in the University/Colleges and also take proper action against those whose are indulging into it.
\n To root out ragging in all its forms from the institution by prohibiting it by law and preventing its occurrence by following the provisions of the Regulations of Supreme Court, UGC and Sikkim University
\n Spell out suitable punishments to those found guilty
\n FUNCTIONS OF THE ANTI-RAGGING COMMITTEE
\n To get an undertaking in the prescribed format from the candidate concerned on anti ragging.
\n To address the students and parents by the head of the institutions on anti ragging.
\n To arrange to send letters to parents, guardians of the students at the end of the academic year for creation of awareness.
\n To coordinate with the institutions affiliated and calling for periodical reports from them.
\n To form monitoring cells (sub-committees) consisting of mentors at the end of academic year.
\n To suggest measures to tighten the security.
\n To recommend withdrawal of affiliation of institutions which did not curb ragging effectively.
